senses.sense_definition: Lying flat on the ground with the face downwards.

examples.text: The exhausted runner lay <w>prostrate</w> on the grass after the race.
Worshippers fell <w>prostrate</w> on the floor during the ceremony.

senses.sense_definition: Physically weak or unable to stand due to illness, exhaustion, or extreme conditions.

examples.text: The hikers were <w>prostrate</w> from the intense desert heat.
He remained <w>prostrate</w> in bed for days due to the fever.

senses.sense_definition: Overwhelmed by strong emotion, such as grief or shock.

examples.text: The family was <w>prostrate</w> with grief after the tragic accident.
She was <w>prostrate</w> with shock when she heard the news.
This <w>prostrate</w> shrub is excellent for covering rocky ground.
The plant has a <w>prostrate</w> habit and spreads quickly across the soil.

senses.sense_definition: To throw oneself flat on the ground, usually as a sign of respect, submission, or worship.

examples.text: The subjects had to <w>prostrate</w> themselves before the king.
You should <w>prostrate</w> yourself to show humility in the temple.

senses.sense_definition: To make someone extremely weak, helpless, or exhausted.

examples.text: The severe flu <w>prostrated</w> him for over a week.
She was completely <w>prostrated</w> by the long journey.
